meanings.definition: A person or thing that is strange or eccentric.
meanings.sent1: The oddballs in the neighborhood always wear mismatched socks.
meanings.sent2: She stood out as an oddball in the group with her quirky sense of humor.
meanings.sent3: The oddballs at the party wore hats made of fruit.
meanings.sent4: In a world of squares, she was the oddball who danced in circles.
meanings.sent5: The oddballs in the forest whispered secrets to the trees.

meanings.definition: A person who is considered to be different from others in a way that is interesting or amusing.
meanings.sent1: The kids at school thought he was one of the oddballs because he collected rocks.
meanings.sent2: She became friends with the oddball in the office who always had a new joke to share.
meanings.sent3: The oddballs at the zoo taught the penguins how to dance.
meanings.sent4: She was the oddball in the family, always dreaming of flying like a bird.
meanings.sent5: The oddballs in the library whispered stories to the books.
